The Campus Security cares about the safety of the students and is easily accessible.
Greek life is quite prevalent on campus and easy to access
I you can't find an RSO you are looking for you can easily create one yourself.
Very competitive, yet not snobby. Genuinely nice students.
Kuvia, a week long event during second week of winter quarter, and ends in a polar bear run.
This college is very expensive, but applying for aid helps out tremendously.
There is a train station near campus that goes straight to downtown.
The food isn't too bad, but it's definitely not 5 star quality. The cafeteria workers are very nice.
The house system is the best. You can expect to meet your first and closest friends through housing.
Classes are very rigorous and require a lot of time commitment, but it is worth it.

If you're looking for a college where you can maintain a 4.0 gpa and not have too work to hard for, then you're looking in the wrong place. This school is very challenging, but the pay off is definitely worth it. And the people you will meet are great.

The University of Chicago is a wonderfully diverse community of students. There are many great opportunities offered, both for the present and for your future, and this school is a great investment. Plus, there's always something fun to do!

Don't get caught up with your test scores and having the highest GPA. There are 2 dining halls (as of 2013-14), a food court with national chains, and more coffee shops than you can imagine. There are also two small grocery store type markets on campus. And if you get tired of campus dining, there are plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from!, 257805=Scav- Every year, for one weekend, UChicago students participate in the world's largest scavenger hunt to try to finish a list of over 300 items. Kuviasungnerk- a week-long January festival where hundreds of students wake up at 5 a.m. every day to do calisthenics or sun salutations by Lake Michighan, literally saluting the sun as it rises. Humans vs. Zombies- A quarterly event where hundreds of students fight the zombie apocalypse. Hosted by the UChicago Zombie Readiness Taskforce, one student (the lead zombie) attempts to spread a human-flesh craving virus among other participating students. Humans defend themselves by shooting nerf darts at zombies. If you are a human, and you're tagged by a zombie, you will become one. Buildings are safe, but the outside is not. textAfterTable: Am learning a lot For me, one of the key points of a school was that it had to be academically challenging. UChicago absolutely fits the bill here. The courses are rigorous, and the professors go out of their way to make the course interesting and highly educational. Login to rate or flag the reviews Michael from Washington 11/28/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 33 out of 34 people found this review useful. 3 of 76 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you don't sincerely enjoy the pursuit of knowledge, you won't like it here. You run into far more students who say they don't particularly care about the increased paycheck foreseen for college graduates than who list that as a top 5 reason for coming here.
